page.title: 09SPRINGFIELDS_WHAT TO SEE
page.content: At Springfields there are well laid out gardens with displays of{flowers,} together with a{woodland area, sunken {gardens, paved walks, lawns, lake and {glasshouses}planted with hundreds of varieties of tulips. In the summer there is a display of over 12,500 rose bushes which include many varities. The plants on display come from many parts of the United Kingdom. There are numerous unusual plants in the gardens including two Chinese trees and flowering cherries from the Royal Gardens in Japan. There are{shops, a restuarant, a {cafetaria, toilets and wheelchairs for {hire and ramps for the disabled. { }The site also has{telephones, an {information centre, exhibition hall, {arena, large car and coach parks and {emergency rooms. { }
